Package edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train

Training routines for base generative models (e.g., phrase tables, lexical reordering models).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    FeatureExtractor
    Interface for extracting sentence-level and phrase-level features from training data.
    PhraseExtractor
    Interface for phrase extraction (or, more specifically, extraction of AlignmentTemplateInstance objects).
    PhrasePrinter  
    SourceFilter
    Filter for phrase extraction: a given phrase pair (F,E) is extracted and weighed only if F is listed is accepted by the filter.
    StatisticsCollector
    Interface for collecting global statistics from training data.
    WordAligner
    An interface for getting out word alignment information from a WordAlignment and other possible information, such as IBMModel1, etc.
    WordAlignment
    Interface to word alignments for one sentence pair.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractFeatureExtractor
    Feature extractor offering default implementations for members of FeatureExtractor.
    AbstractPhraseExtractor
    The preferred way of instanciating PhraseExtractor is to extend AbstractPhraseExtractor.
    AbstractSourceFilter  
    AbstractWordAlignment
    Abstract class representing a set of word alignments for one sentence pair.
    AER
    Compute AER from four files: two corpus files, one reference alignment, and one machine alignment.
    AlGridCell<T extends AlignmentTemplateInstance>
    Information associated with each cell of an AlignmentGrid.
    AlignmentGrid
    A representation of an AlignmentTemplate collection as a matrix.
    AlignmentSymmetrizer
    Alignment symmetrization algorithms.
    AlignmentTemplate
    An alignment template: a source-language phrase (f), a target-language phrase (c), and word alignment.
    AlignmentTemplateInstance
    An alignment template and its position within a sentence pair.
    AlignmentTemplates
    AlignmentTemplates is a collection that maps between AlignmentTemplate instances and a contiguous non-negative integer index series beginning (inclusively) at 0.
    Block
    Same as IntQuadruple, but with method names that reflect a two-coordinate system.
    CombinedStatisticsCollector
    go through the SentencePairs and collect global information General structure following PhraseExtract class
    CorpusOverlapFinder
    Class for finding long n-gram sequences that appear in both training and test data.
    CountFeatureExtractor
    Extractor for printing the number of occurrences of each alignment template.
    DependencyPhraseExtractor
    Same as MosesPhraseExtractor, but restricts phrases according to dependencies read from an info file.
    DiscontinuousSubSequences  
    DTUFeatureExtractor  
    DTUInstance  
    DTUPhraseExtractor  
    DTUSourceFilter  
    DualWordAlignment
    Read in the "f2e" alignments, for two different alignment files.
    FlatPhraseExtractor
    Implementation of phrase-extract that runs in time O(m * s * t), where m is the maximum phrase length, and s and t are respectively the lengths of the source and target sentence.
    GIZAWordAlignment
    Sentence pair with GIZA word alignment, with GIZA alignment probability for each direction.
    IBMModel1InformedWordAligner
    This class makes use of the GIZA++ style alignment information in SymmetricalWordAlignment to limit the possible English word alignment choice, and then use IBM Model1 score to pick the best one Notice it's not an "IBMModel1Aligner", because it first constrains the possibilities to only the indices provided in the SymmetricalWordAlignment information
    IBMWordAlignmentHandler  
    LexicalReorderingFeatureExtractor
    Extractor for lexicalized re-ordering probabilities of Moses.
    MosesPharoahFeatureExtractor
    Extractor for the five base feature functions of Moses/Pharaoh (four translation probabilities plus phrase penalty).
    ParaphraseExtractor
    Prints a monolingual (source-language) phrase table instead of bilingual, using the target language as a pivot to find correspondance between source-language phrases.
    PhiFeatureExtractor
    Extractor for p(e|f), one of the five base feature functions of Moses/Pharaoh.
    PhrasalSourceFilter  
    PhraseExtract
    Combines multiple phrase-level feature extractors into one, and prints their outputs to STDOUT.
    PlainPhrasePrinter  
    ReorderingWithSyntaticPhrasalCategoryFeatureExtractor
    This class follows the idea of OldLexicalReorderingFeatureExtractor, but instead of conditioning on the phrases, we label each statistical phrase with the syntatic phrasal categories and condition on those.
    ShallowSyntacticContextFeatureExtractor
    Feature extractor collecting function words appearing right next to a given alignment template.
    ShortestDistanceWordAligner  
    SoftMosesPharoahFeatureExtractor  
    SoftPhraseExtractor
    Extracts phrase pairs with up to a given number of crossings.
    SparseVectorFeatureExtractor
    Class that associates one sparse vector to each alignment template.
    Subsampler
    Subsample corpus, adding more training sentence pairs until each ngram of a given dev/test set is seen at least N times in the training data (this is close to the Chris Dyer implementation in /u/nlp/data/gale/scr/umd-mttools.jar).
    SymmetricalWordAlignment
    Sentence pair with symmetrical word alignment (i.e., if e_i aligns to f_j in one direction, then f_j aligns to e_i as well in the other direction).
    SyntacticPhraseReorderingFeatureExtractor  
    VerbPhraseBoundary  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AlignmentGrid.RelativePos  

Package edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train Description

Training routines for base generative models (e.g., phrase tables, lexical reordering models).
